info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Burke County through 600 PM EDT... At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of Morganton, moving southwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morganton, Drexel, Glen Alpine, Table Rock, Lake James, Lake James State Park, Lake Rhodhiss, South Mountains State Park and Oak Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
